Operation 'ListMessage' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Filter all messages' is vague and doesn't indicate retrieval action. Description is lengthy and focuses on query format rather than what the operation returns. Improved summary uses action verb 'Query and retrieve'. Enhanced description clarifies the operation returns a filtered list, mentions pagination, and removes redundant format examples while maintaining reference to documentation.

data.current_description:
Filter all messages to search your Email Activity. All queries must be [URL encoded](https://meyerweb.com/eric/tools/dencoder/), and use the following format:

`query={query_type}="{query_content}"`

 Once URL encoded, the previous query will look like this:

`query=type%3D%22query_content%22`

For example, to filter by a specific email, use the following query:

`query=to_email%3D%22example%40example.com%22`

Visit our [Query Reference section](https://docs.sendgrid.com/for-developers/sending-email/getting-started-email-activity-api#query-reference) to see a full list of basic query types and examples.
data.summary_suggestion: Query and retrieve filtered email messages
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of email messages from your Email Activity, filtered by query parameters. Accepts URL-encoded query strings in the format `query={query_type}="{query_content}"` (e.g., `query=to_email%3D%22example%40example.com%22`). Returns a paginated list of messages matching the specified criteria. Refer to the Query Reference documentation for available query types and filtering options.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Filter all messages' is vague and doesn't indicate retrieval action. Description is lengthy and focuses on query format rather than what the operation returns. Improved summary uses action verb 'Query and retrieve'. Enhanced description clarifies the operation returns a filtered list, mentions pagination, and removes redundant format examples while maintaining reference to documentation.

message: Operation 'GetMessage' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary uses 'Filter' which is imprecise for a single-message retrieval operation. Description is too brief and doesn't specify what details are returned. Improved summary clarifies the retrieval action and specificity. Enhanced description explains what information is returned (status, recipient, events, metadata) to help AI agents understand the operation's output.

data.current_description: Get all of the details about the specified message.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve detailed message information by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves comprehensive details for a specific email message identified by its message ID. Returns the complete message record including delivery status, recipient information, event history, and associated metadata from your Email Activity.
data.reasoning: Original summary uses 'Filter' which is imprecise for a single-message retrieval operation. Description is too brief and doesn't specify what details are returned. Improved summary clarifies the retrieval action and specificity. Enhanced description explains what information is returned (status, recipient, events, metadata) to help AI agents understand the operation's output.

message: Operation 'RequestCsv' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_side_effects. Original summary 'Request CSV' is too generic. Description is verbose and includes unnecessary comparison to other endpoints. Improved summary clarifies the asynchronous nature and purpose. Enhanced description consolidates key information: what happens (async generation), scope (30 days, 1M events), delivery method (email), link expiration, query compatibility, rate limits, and response details for better AI agent understanding of operation behavior and constraints.

data.current_description:
This request will kick off a backend process to generate a CSV file. Once generated, the worker will then send an email for the user download the file. The link will expire in 3 days.

The CSV will contain the events from the last 30 days, limited to the last 1 million events maximum. This endpoint will be rate limited to 1 request every 12 hours (rate limit may change).

This endpoint is similar to the GET Single Message endpoint - the only difference is that /download is added to indicate that this is a CSV download requests but the same query is used to determine what the CSV should contain.
data.summary_suggestion: Request asynchronous CSV export of email activity
data.description_suggestion: Initiates an asynchronous background process to generate a CSV export of email messages matching your query criteria. The export includes events from the last 30 days (maximum 1 million events). Upon completion, a download link is sent via email and remains valid for 3 days. Accepts the same query parameters as the message list endpoint. Rate limited to 1 request per 12 hours. Returns a 202 Accepted response with a download UUID for tracking the request.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Request CSV' is too generic. Description is verbose and includes unnecessary comparison to other endpoints. Improved summary clarifies the asynchronous nature and purpose. Enhanced description consolidates key information: what happens (async generation), scope (30 days, 1M events), delivery method (email), link expiration, query compatibility, rate limits, and response details for better AI agent understanding of operation behavior and constraints.

message: Operation 'DownloadCsv' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Download CSV' is ambiguous - it doesn't clarify that this returns a URL rather than the file itself. Description is minimal and doesn't explain the relationship to RequestCsv or how to use the endpoint. Improved summary clarifies the presigned URL concept. Enhanced description explains the prerequisite (RequestCsv), required parameter (download_uuid), and clarifies the operation returns a URL for temporary file access rather than the file itself.

data.current_description: **This endpoint will return a presigned URL that can be used to download the CSV that was requested from the "Request a CSV" endpoint.**
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve presigned URL for CSV download
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a presigned URL for downloading the CSV file generated by a prior CSV export request. Requires the download UUID returned from the RequestCsv endpoint. The presigned URL provides temporary access to the generated CSV file containing your email activity data. Use the download_uuid path parameter to identify which export to retrieve.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Download CSV' is ambiguous - it doesn't clarify that this returns a URL rather than the file itself. Description is minimal and doesn't explain the relationship to RequestCsv or how to use the endpoint. Improved summary clarifies the presigned URL concept. Enhanced description explains the prerequisite (RequestCsv), required parameter (download_uuid), and clarifies the operation returns a URL for temporary file access rather than the file itself.

data.current_description:
This request will kick off a backend process to generate a CSV file. Once generated, the worker will then send an email for the user download the file. The link will expire in 3 days.

The CSV will contain the events from the last 30 days, limited to the last 1 million events maximum. This endpoint will be rate limited to 1 request every 12 hours (rate limit may change).

This endpoint is similar to the GET Single Message endpoint - the only difference is that /download is added to indicate that this is a CSV download requests but the same query is used to determine what the CSV should contain.
data.summary_suggestion: Request asynchronous CSV export of email activity
data.description_suggestion: Initiates an asynchronous process to generate a CSV file containing filtered email activity data. Accepts the same query parameters as the message list endpoint to determine CSV contents. Returns a 202 Accepted response with a download UUID. The generated CSV includes events from the last 30 days (maximum 1 million events) and will be sent via email with a download link valid for 3 days. Rate limited to 1 request per 12 hours. Use the returned UUID with the Download CSV endpoint to retrieve the presigned download URL.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Request CSV' is too generic. Description is verbose and includes unnecessary comparison to other endpoints. Improved version clarifies the asynchronous nature, specifies data scope and limitations, explains the workflow (request  email  download), and indicates how to use the returned UUID, making it more actionable for AI agents.

data.current_description: **This endpoint will return a presigned URL that can be used to download the CSV that was requested from the "Request a CSV" endpoint.**
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve presigned URL for CSV download
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a presigned URL for downloading a previously requested CSV export. Requires the download UUID returned from the Request CSV endpoint as a path parameter. Returns a presigned URL that can be used to directly download the generated CSV file. The URL is valid for 3 days from the time the CSV was generated.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a presigned URL for downloading the CSV file generated by a prior CSV export request. Requires the download UUID returned from the RequestCsv endpoint. The presigned URL provides temporary access to the generated CSV file containing your email activity data. Use the download_uuid path parameter to identify which export to retrieve.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Download CSV' is ambiguous - it doesn't clarify that this returns a URL rather than the file itself. Description is minimal and doesn't explain the relationship to RequestCsv or how to use the endpoint. Improved summary clarifies the presigned URL concept. Enhanced description explains the prerequisite (RequestCsv), required parameter (download_uuid), and clarifies the operation returns a URL for temporary file access rather than the file itself.

message: Semantic analysis completed: 4 operations analyzed, 4 quality issues found
